sentences.en: " I suppose you feel itchy not pulling a rickshaw!
sentences.cn: “ 一天不拉车,身上就痒痒,是不是?

sentences.en: " Whoever heard of ten cents? " drawled the rickshaw man.
sentences.cn: “ 那里有一毛钱的,车夫懒懒地说.

sentences.en: " You come to my place and want to pay the rickshaw fare?
sentences.cn: 到了我这儿啦,还没个车钱 吗 !

sentences.en: A rickshaw driver looks for customers to take to The Gold Market, Shai Mahala.
sentences.cn: 夏马哈拉，人力车司机正在寻觅要搭车去黄金市场的人。

sentences.en: And there's a transition: People come in from the countryside, enter the rickshaw economy, and work for almost nothing.
sentences.cn: 还有一个过渡：人们从乡村来到城市，几乎没有什么工作好做，就成为人力车经济的一部分。

sentences.en: At such times, he would think of buying a rickshaw.
sentences.cn: 在这种时候, 他又想起买车.

sentences.en: Before liberation he had to pull a rickshaw to earn a little money.
sentences.cn: 解放前他不得不拉人力车来挣点儿钱.

sentences.en: Er Qiangzi, in his forties, decided to stop pulling a rickshaw.
sentences.cn: 二强子四十多了, 打算不再去拉车.

sentences.en: He pulls a rickshaw, probably the oldest form of human taxi service.
sentences.cn: 他拉黄包车，这可能是人类最古老的载客服务形式了。

sentences.en: Oh , but my useless muscles couldn't even cope with a rickshaw. "
sentences.cn: 啊啊, 但是我这一双弱腕,怕吃不下一部 黄包车 的重力.

sentences.en: That was all there was to the relationship between man and rickshaw.
sentences.cn: 人与车的关系不过如此.

sentences.en: The private rickshaw bells rang endlessly, their steel wires shone brightly.
sentences.cn: 包车踏铃不断地响着.钢丝在闪着亮.

sentences.en: The rickshaw pullers all had matches, but only two rickshaws had lamps.
sentences.cn: 车夫全有火柴, 可是只有两辆车有灯.

sentences.en: They were all rickshaw pullers, why this division into high and low?
sentences.cn: 同是拉车的, 为什么有三六九等 呢 ?

sentences.en: Tomorrow, no rickshaw rent , but all rickshaws back by four.
sentences.cn: 明天的车份儿不要了,四点收车.

sentences.en: Xiangzi really felt like dropping the rickshaw and finding shelter.
sentences.cn: 祥子真想硬把车放下,去找个地方避一避.

sentences.en: You're rickshaw pullers; Fourth Liu is in a different line, get it? "
sentences.cn: 你们拉车, 刘四并不和你们同行, 明白? ”

trans.tran_en: a small vehicle used in South East Asia for carrying one or two passengers. It is pulled by someone walking or riding a bicycle.
